algorithm_technique: Iterator design pattern using a deque to manage nested iterators
problem_summary_simple: Design an iterator to traverse elements of a 2D vector sequentially, supporting next and hasNext operations.
problem_summary_technical: Implement an iterator using a deque to store (length, iterator) pairs of inner lists, efficiently managing nested iteration for flattening.
key_insights: A deque is used to efficiently manage the heads of the inner iterators.
The `hasNext` operation checks if the deque is empty.
The `next` operation pops from the deque, returns the next element, and re-appends if the inner iterator has more elements.
